Utterance: Hi there! It’s Ellie. How have you been since our last session?
Hey! I’ve been okay. I actually tried writing a song like we talked about.
That’s fantastic! How did that go for you?
It was a bit rough, but I enjoyed the process. I didn’t put too much pressure on myself, which helped.
That’s great to hear! Focusing on the process rather than the outcome is a huge step. What did you learn from it?
I learned that it’s okay to not be perfect. I had fun, and that’s what matters.
Absolutely! It’s wonderful that you found joy in the creative process. Are you planning to continue working on that project?
Yeah, I think I will. I want to keep exploring it, maybe even collaborate with some friends.
That sounds like a great idea! Collaboration can lead to new ideas and experiences. How do you feel about reaching out to your friends for input?
I feel good about it. I think they’d be supportive.
That’s wonderful! Now, let’s check in on your mindfulness practice. How has that been going for you?
I’ve been trying to do some breathing exercises, and it’s been surprisingly helpful.
I’m glad to hear that! Have you noticed any changes in how you handle stress or anger since starting those exercises?
Definitely. I feel like I’m more aware of my emotions now, and it’s easier to take a step back before reacting.
That’s a significant improvement! It sounds like you’re developing a better understanding of your triggers. Can you think of a specific situation where you applied mindfulness?
Yeah, there was a moment last week when I felt really stressed at work. Instead of snapping at someone, I took a few deep breaths and calmed down.
That’s an excellent example! You’re really making progress in managing your reactions. Is there anything else you’d like to work on today?
I think I want to talk more about my relationships. I feel like I could improve my connections with friends.
That’s a great topic. What aspects of your relationships do you feel could use improvement?
I think I tend to isolate myself sometimes. I want to be more proactive in reaching out to friends.
That’s a positive realization. What do you think holds you back from reaching out?
I guess sometimes I just assume they’re busy or that they won’t want to hang out.
It’s natural to have those thoughts, but often people appreciate being invited. What if you made a plan to reach out to one friend this week?
I could do that. Maybe I’ll invite someone to grab coffee or something.
That sounds like a wonderful idea! Building those connections can be very fulfilling. How do you feel about setting that as a goal for this week?
I feel good about it. I think it’ll help me feel more connected.
Excellent! I’m excited to hear how that goes. As we wrap up today, is there anything else on your mind?
No, I think we covered a lot today. I’m feeling pretty good.
I’m glad to hear that! Remember to celebrate the small victories and keep working on those connections. I look forward to hearing about your progress next time.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! Take care, and see you soon.
Bye!
